importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The 2026 Sundance Film Festival begins on January 22, marking the start of a key cultural and artistic event that honors Robert Redford’s legacy through film screenings and programming.
Planning for the Sundance Film Festival’s relocation to Boulder, Colorado, in 2027 is underway, indicating a major shift in the festival’s geographic and institutional future.
This date marks the publication of the article, highlighting the immediate public response to Robert Redford’s death and the festival’s renewed commitment to honoring his legacy.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The 2026 Sundance Film Festival runs from January 22 to February 1, serving as a major platform for independent cinema and the celebration of Redford's foundational role in the industry.

The transition of the festival to Boulder, Colorado, in 2027 represents a significant shift in location and organizational structure, signaling long-term changes in the film festival’s governance and reach.

keyTakeAways: Robert Redford’s death in September 2025 has intensified the significance of the 2026 Sundance Film Festival, which will be the last in Park City, Utah.
The festival will honor Redford’s legacy by screening his first independent film, 'Downhill Racer' (1969), and restoring classic Sundance films such as 'Little Miss Sunshine' and 'House Party'.
A series of archival screenings will include films like 'Saw', 'Mysterious Skin', 'Humpday', and the 35th anniversary of Barbara Kopple’s documentary 'American Dream'.
Film creators and collaborators have expressed emotional connections to Redford’s legacy, with many reaching out to participate in the festival following his passing.

The Sundance Institute and UCLA Film & Television Archive have worked together for nearly 30 years to preserve and promote independent cinema, ensuring these stories remain visible in contemporary culture.
Tickets for the 2026 festival go on sale on Wednesday at noon Eastern time, with world premiere films to be announced in December 2025.
The festival’s future is being planned in Boulder, Colorado, beginning in 2027, marking a shift in location and institutional direction.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Following the death of Robert Redford in September 2025, the 2026 Sundance Film Festival in Park City, Utah, is dedicating a special tribute to his legacy, featuring screenings of his first independent film, 'Downhill Racer' (1969), and a series of restored classics such as 'Little Miss Sunshine,' 'House Party,' 'Saw,' and 'Mysterious Skin.' The event also celebrates key anniversaries, including the 35th of Barbara Kopple’s 'American Dream' and the 20th of 'Half Nelson.' The Sundance Institute and UCLA Film & Television Archive have collaborated for nearly three decades to preserve these films, ensuring their continued cultural relevance. Festival organizers emphasize the emotional impact of Redford’s passing and reaffirm the festival’s mission of empowering diverse voices through independent storytelling. Tickets for the 2026 festival go on sale in early January, with world premieres to be announced in December. In 2027, the festival will relocate to Boulder, Colorado, marking a significant shift in its geographic and institutional future.
title: Sundance Honors Robert Redford’s Legacy with Screenings of Restored Films
